commented_code:
Before the page load, you were bound to the origin policy:
         > #{originPolicy}
 
-      A cross origin error happens when your application navigates to a new superdomain which does not match the origin policy above.
+      A cross origin error happens when your application navigates to a new domain which does not match the origin policy above.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
      A cross origin error happens when your application navigates to a new URL which does not match the origin policy above.
```

since it's not necessarily the domain that's changed

     """
-    cannot_visit_2nd_domain: """
-      #{cmd('visit')} failed because you are attempting to visit a second unique domain.
+    cannot_visit_different_protocol: """
+      #{cmd('visit')} failed because you are attempting to visit a URL that is of a different origin.
+
+      The new URL is considered different origin because the 'protocol' is different.
+
+      You may only 'cy.visit()' same origin URLs within a single test.
+
+      The previous domain you visited was: '{{previousDomain}}'
+
+      You're attempting to visit this URL: '{{attemptedDomain}}'
+
+      You may need to restructure some of your test code to avoid this problem.
+
+      https://on.cypress.io/cannot-visit-different-origin-domain
+    """
+    cannot_visit_different_port: """
+      #{cmd('visit')} failed because you are attempting to visit a URL that is of a different origin.
 
-      You may only visit a single unique domain per test.
+      The new URL is considered different origin because the 'port' is different.

discussion_comments.comment_body: I know that "different origin" is supposed to be read with the same inflection as "same-origin", but it doesn't really read like that to me, what do you think about "a different origin" instead?

commented_code:
URL from the `options` object: {{optionsUrl}}
       URL from the `url` parameter: {{url}}
     """
-    cannot_visit_2nd_domain: """
-      #{cmd('visit')} failed because you are attempting to visit a second unique domain.
+    cannot_visit_different_origin: """
+      #{cmd('visit')} failed because you are attempting to visit a URL that is of a different origin.
 
-      You may only visit a single unique domain per test.
+      The new URL is considered a different origin because the following parts of the URL are different: {{differences}}
 
-      Different subdomains are okay, but unique domains are not.
+      You may only #{cmd('visit')} same origin URLs within a single test.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
      You may only #{cmd('visit')} same-origin URLs within a single test.
```
